intro: Brachystegia cynometroides, commonly known as the African brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a dense, rounded crown with thick, dark green leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in racemes, and it produces pods that contain edible seeds. This species plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
